Once a month you have the chance to win up to £10,000. The player who wins the Jackpot battle receives all the Jackpot pounds they collected from bonus boxes - paid out in cold, hard cash.DarkOrbit will keep you coming back for more!
Explore the infinite expanses of outer space in one of the best browser-based, action-packed space shooters ever made. Fly into the face of danger and go where nobody has ever gone before - either on your own or with others. Set a course to discover new galaxies and new lifeforms.
Join one of the three DarkOrbit companies in their struggle to gain control over the universe. Gear up for battle and fight to the bitter end to gain wealth and power in this browser game.
Stock up your ship and transform it from a simple Starjet to the universe's most feared battlecruiser: Fulfill your destiny!© Bigpoint - All rights reservedFree online games - Win €10,000Legal informationCreditsDarkOrbitThe action-packed Space MMO for your browserProducerProject ManagerGame DesignDevelopmentGraphicsQuality AssuranceCommunity ManagementInternsSpecial thanks toMore information about DarkOrbitTerms & ConditionsGamesNow online:Registered:LOGINForgot your password?Username:Password:RegisterLanguage:ScreenshotsDetailsTrailerPrizesIn-game videoInfoDarkOrbit – The best browser-based space shooter

DarkOrbit – The best browser-based space shooter

  • Play now against thousands of real players!
  • DarkOrbit is an action-packed space adventure.
  • Browser games: no download, no installation!
The free massively multiplayer online space gameDarkOrbit is a top multiplayer online game and one of the best games that browser games have to offer. If you're a fan of action games, then you're really going to love DarkOrbit: Your mission here is to hunt enemies in outer space and shoot them down on behalf of your company. The universe is brimming with thousands of real opponents for you to compete against! DarkOrbit isn't just any ordinary online game: It's a truly irresistible online game for fans of space games!

Thousands of real players fight to the bitter end in this multiplayer online game which can be played right in your browser. That's why online games such as DarkOrbit are often called browser games: They are Internet games with substance and a whole lot of action.

Space games with the same caliber as DarkOrbit are revolutionizing the world of browser games. Navigate your spaceship from the bridge in action-packed space battles with your mouse or keyboard. Join alliances: Browser games make it possible for you to play with and against thousands of real players in real time.Other terms from the browser game DarkOrbit:Online games – more than %s million people play DarkOrbit!DarkOrbit - the great online space game from ScifiJoin millions of other star pilots to battle alien and player spaceships. kill/damageSaimon kill day

In today's event your mission is to destroy as many Saimon ships as possible.
Every ship destroyed is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on the type of your ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-3 and X-4 maps.Devolarium damage day

Your mission in today's event is to cause as much damage to Devolarium ships as possible.
Every damage point shot is worth 1 point. You can also receive up to a 100% bonus depending on your type of ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-3 maps.Mordon kill day

Your assignment in today's event is to destroy as many Mordon ships as possible.
Every ship destroyed is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on the type of your ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-3 and X-4 maps.Sibelon damage day

Your mission in today's event is to cause as much damage to Sibelon ships as possible.
Every damage point shot is worth 1 point. You can also receive up to a 100% bonus depending on your type of ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-4 maps.Space marathon

Your assignment in today's event is to fly back and forth between the two home bases as often as possible.
You'll receive 10 points for every round trip you make.
You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on the type of your ship. The competition ends at midnight.

You'll find these bases on the X-1 and X-8 maps.Streuner kill day

It's up to you in today's event to destroy as many Streuner ships as possible.
Every ship shot down is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on the type of your ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-1, X-2, X-8 maps (Streuner).Protegite kill day

Your assignment in today's event is to destroy as many Protegite ships as possible.
Every ship shot down is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on the type of your ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-6 maps.Lordakium damage day

Your mission in today's event is to cause as much damage to Lordakium ships as possible.
For every shot which causes damage you'll receive one point. You can also receive up to a 100% bonus depending on your type of ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-5 maps.Variety kill day

It's up to you today to destroy as many ships as possible.
All NPCs count. Every ship destroyed is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on your type of ship.

The goal here is to shoot down as many opponents as possible!
For every additional type of opponent's ship destroyed, the multiplier increases by a factor of 1. If you destroy another opponent of this type, the multiplier will be reset to 1 and the multiplying process starts over again. Always make sure that you shoot down each type of opponent only once.Lordakia/Saimon kill day

Your mission in today's event is to shoot down as many Lordakia and Saimon ships as possible.
Every ship destroyed is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on your type of ship. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-2, X-3, X-4 and X-5 maps.Lordakium/Sibelon damage day

Your assignment in today's event is to cause as much damage to Lordakium and Sibelon ships as possible.
For every shot which causes damage you'll receive 1 point. You can also receive up to a 100% bonus depending on your ship type. The competition ends at midnight.

These ships can be found on the X-4 and X-5 maps.Variety Kill Day

It's up to you today to destroy as many ships as possible.
All NPCs and real players count. Every ship destroyed is worth 10 points. You can also receive up to 10 bonus points depending on your type of ship.

This score will be multiplied by the number of opponent types to calculate the total score.

For every additional type of opponent's ship destroyed, the multiplier increases by a factor of 1. If you destroy another opponent of this type, the multiplier will be reset to 1 and the multiplying process will start over again.Variety Kill and Damage Day

In today's event, you need to destroy as many ships and achieve as many hit points as possible.

All NPCs and real players count. Every ship shot down is worth 40,000 points. Depending on your type of ship, you can also receive up to 40,000 bonus points.

In addition, for every shot which causes damage you'll receive 1 point. Depending on the type of ship, you can receive up to a 100% bonus.

This score will be multiplied by the number of opponent types to calculate the total score.

For every additional type of opponent's ship destroyed, the multiplier increases by a factor of 1. It's time to kick off the third round of the DarkOrbit Summer Games.
Hop in your cockpit, become the SG3 Champion and rake in the rewards!DarkOrbit Summer Games 3
The time has finally come: The DarkOrbit Summer Games have officially opened!
Gear up for action, fun and adventure in the battle for highly coveted medals and the title of the Summer Games Champion. Be there when the games begin: Fight either alone or with your company for honor, glory and a whole bunch of wicked prizes.
There will be a new event each day for you to compete in and test your skills against the galaxy's best space pilots to see who can take home the prize.

- Your account will be credited with points for every daily event.
- Your 10 best results from the daily events will determine your overall standing in the Summer Game Championships.
- The player who has collected the most Championship points by the end of the Summer Games will take home the main prize: an entire month's subscription to an indestructible #9 drone.

Pilots ranked in positions 2 to 100 will also receive great prizes for their outstanding performances.
Don't miss out on the action - fight for your spot in the event of the summer: the DarkOrbit Summer Games 3.SBSBPlease turn off your pop-up blocker!AmountNo Credits or Uridium left? No problem!
Click here to get more.Don't show again.Buy nowBuy nowThe Delta Gate

With a little bit of blood, sweat and tears, our space pilots were able to recover pieces of an ancient device from existing gates in outer space.

The advancements made exploring the Alpha, Beta and Gamma maps is finally paying off: A new generator was developed which only produces parts for the Delta gate.

The Delta gate leads into the legendary Delta galaxy where not one single member of the three companies has ever been able to penetrate thus far. Nobody knows what exists there! Be the first brave soul to enter this brand new world.

You can find the Delta gate under "Galaxy gates" – you can't miss it!Greetings Space Pilots,

An invasion is headed your way! And it just couldn't come at a worse time: On the 999th and 1,000th day anniversary of DarkOrbit! We don't know how the blasted aliens were able to do it, but on each company's home map there is now an Invasion gate which leads to a separate galaxy where the invasion map is located. Evil invaders from outer space are just lying in wait on this map, ready to descend on your home map!

But this primitive group of aliens made a big mistake: They didn't think it was possible to enter the Invasion map with a whole armada of space pilots - but it is!

  • Those who click on "Jump" first will be among the first to fight! All other pilots will have to wait until one of the fighters from the armada has been shot down and then it will be their turn to move up and take over a position fighting the enemy!
  • In order to remain in the succession list and attack the alien slime, make sure not to leave your home map, or else you'll have to go to the back of line and wait all over again. Each alien who is destroyed will earn you one point for your company.
  • All three companies are under threat of attack: The company which destroys the most aliens and therefore gathers the most points from September 5-6, 2009 will be rewarded with a 10% damage bonus for 1 whole week. The companies in 2nd and 3rd place will receive a 5% or 3% damage bonus.

In addition to this fight, whoever has enough power left over will also be rewarded with a special excursion to the Anniversary Galaxy Gate! This gate will be set up close to your home base: The only requirement is that you log into the star chart on September 5th or 6th. The gate will be active for a maximum of one month, until you've accomplished the quest there. It will be closed for good at the latest on October 6, 2009!

During these two days of special quests, space pilots will also find bonus boxes with twice the content and payment multipliers!

Any questions? Please take a look at the attached FAQ.

Blast off for battle, space pilots! Make your company proud: They're counting on you!

The Company Board of Directors


FAQ

Why is there a 999/1,000-day event?

DarkOrbit is turning 999 and 1,000 days old. And to celebrate, a huge anniversary event is being thrown. The DarkOrbit team can't wait to celebrate this memorable occasion with you, and hopes that you'll stick around to see the next big event for 2,000 days of DarkOrbit. As a token of our appreciation, we'd like to thank you for your loyalty and bravery over the years with this especially challenging event!

What is the 999/1,000 Gate?

The 999/1,000 Gate works exactly the same way as a normal galaxy gate. Every player, regardless of their level or equipment, can access this gate and play. In order to access the gate, all you have to do is fly to it and activate the portal jump. Just remember to equip your ship as much as possible before you enter the gate. Your performance in the 999/1,000 Gate will be recorded in a ranking.

What exactly is the Invasion gate?

The Invasion gate can only materialize every 1,000 days. Take heed, pilots! The largest threat the universe of DarkOrbit has ever encountered lurks behind this gate. You'll see that one gate has materialized on each of the company's maps, and which can only be accessed by the members of that company. A limited number of company members can use the gate at the same time in order to fight against the extremely hostile alien invaders. If there are already too many users who have passed through this gate, you'll be put in a waiting list if you try to activate the portal jump. As soon as the aliens defeat your fellow combatants and blow them to pieces, then you'll be transported through the gate one by one as reinforcements for your company.

How can my company win the 10% bonus?

The company which has collected the most points on the invasion map by the end of the event will receive a 10% damage bonus for the entire next week. The second- and third-placed companies will be rewarded accordingly with a bonus of 5% (2nd place) and 3% (3rd place) for one whole week.

What happens if I'm blown to smithereens on the Invasion map?

If you're destroyed on an Invasion map, you can repair your ship for free and your drones can't be damaged at all there.

Space pilots, just remember: Fortune favors the bold with the greatest honor of all. So fight on behalf of your company!Insta-Repair at DarkOrbit

From zero to hero in the blink of an eye: Push the limit at the speed of lightning!


Greetings Space Pilots,

It's time for you to stop putting up with guff from others and fight back with the brand-new Insta-Repair which allows you to strike back quickly with a vengeance. Those who cause you damage better beware, because with the Insta-Repair you've got an ace up your sleeve!

This is how it works:

  • Whoever has less than their maximum number of hit points may use the Insta-Repair.
  • You can activate it at your home base.
  • Within a second, you'll be able to repair your ship back to its maximum number of hit points!


The Insta-Repair usually costs 10 repair credits … but honestly, it's worth collecting all the repair credits for this item. The moment where you catch your opponent off guard by fighting back at full tilt is all too sweet to resist – the Insta-Repair is the perfect joker for you to take revenge!Breaking news: Make room for something new!

Introducing a new feature for you to sell your ammo!

What can you do with your extra ammo? Throwing it away would be a down-right shame, but it's not like you can use it either. So that's why we came up with a solution for you to sell your ammunition for Credits, fill up your account and get your hands on the ammunition you really need!
  • Go to the hangar
  • Select the menu item Equipment
  • Click on the ammo and then hit Sell

The first aid kit for ammo-hoarding pilots: Out with the old and in with the new. Get rid of all that old ammunition, such as rockets, mines, and laser batteries, which is just collecting dust on the shelves. Starting now, there's no need for you to throw your old trash over board; trade them in and earn some cold hard cash!In useBuy nowTech FactoryYou may construct the item in the tech factory.Tech FactoryBuy nowBidPlease waitSpeedRocketsHit pointsLasersRocket launchersCargoExtrasGeneratorsBatteriesDo you really want to buy the %SHIP_NAME% ship for %SHIP_PRICE%?Do you really want to buy the %MODEL_NAME% design for %MODEL_PRICE%?When you buy a new spaceship, the old ship will be scrapped,

DarkOrbit's 3rd Anniversary - Capture the Beacon

Greetings Space Pilots,
Celebrate DarkOrbit's 3rd Anniversary by joining in the fun and playing Capture the Beacon! Capture the Beacon is similar to the popular classic Capture the Flag, which you may or may not already know from other games.

Here are the rules:

  • Each company has a special zone on the X-2 map. In this zone, there are two beacons, each belonging to one enemy company, which you need to protect.
  • At the same time you must try to retrieve your own beacons from the enemy X-2 maps.
  • You'll receive one point as soon as your company brings its own beacon into its own zone and you prevent the enemy teams from capturing their beacons.

The player who has captured a beacon will show up on the mini map and won't have any attack protection during this time. If this player is using his/her cloaking device, it will be deactivated. The current score of a match and the position of the beacons can be seen on the star chart.

Multiple CTB matches will be played throughout the day. The company who wins a CTB match will receive their reward during the next hour. A reward will also be presented at the end of the day to the company who wins the most matches.

Have a blast playing Capture the Beacon. For those of you who don't want to play CTB, we've got some other special surprises planned for you today!

Your DarkOrbit Team

Kick off the new year with a bang


Greetings Space Pilots,

Yet another year is coming to an end, and to celebrate, DarkOrbit is throwing a huge party with a spectacular display of fireworks!


We went all out this year, getting our hands on every type of firework we could scrounge up:


  • You'll find three different sizes of fireworks.
  • They can be bought in the hangar, and also found in small quantities in bonus boxes on the map.
  • And the best thing of all is that the fireworks won't take up any room in your armory!
  • You can buy these special explosives from Dec. 28, 2009 to Dec. 31, 2009, but you won't be able to start your "symphony of fire" until Dec. 31, 2009!
  • Position up to five fireworks wherever you want on the map, and click on the button to detonate!

Warning: According to intergalactic space law, each ship can only carry up to 9,999 fireworks on board to minimize the risk of explosion. Any fireworks which you collect above this number will be launched out into space and join the rest of the space debris.


We wish you a Happy New Year!

Your DarkOrbit Team

New DarkOrbit client


Amazing design, large field of vision, personalized HUD plus much, much more.


Greetings Space Pilots,

Jump-start your new year and blast off with us as the brand-new DarkOrbit client goes live on January 20, 2010.


After the successful client testing of the beta server, we tracked down and removed all bugs we could find. Now that everything's been perfected and fine-tuned, it's time for the new client to make its grand debut by becoming your new panoramic window into outer space.


The new client has:

  • a large field of vision
  • adjustable resolution
  • amazing lighting effects
  • mind-boggling explosions
  • personalized HUD
  • more information on the star chart

Now you'll be able to see all the information you need at one glance. Have a blast with the new client!


In addition to the new design, a number of changes were made to the new client, using cutting-edge programming to make the game more responsive. But that's not all we've got planned. We've set our sights on adding more maps, more NPCs and other great features in upcoming game updates.


If you're not yet ready to explore the next frontier, you can continue to use the old client until the next big game update is made. Just remember that we won't be able to incorporate the features we have planned for the future into the old client, so you'll have to say good-bye to the old client for good once the next big update is made. Don't worry, as soon as we know when this will happen, we'll make sure to inform you.

Test out the brand-new client today!

Your DarkOrbit Team

;Breakthrough in rocket research!After a long development phase and exhaustive testing, the rocket research department is proud to present two groundbreaking new items.


Now available at the hangar:


  • Rocket CPU: If you have less than 100 rockets on board, this CPU will automatically buy 500 rockets of the selected rocket type. You'll never run out of rockets again!
  • PLT 3030: A long-range rocket with impressive firepower. Combine it with the Tech Center's precision targeter to make up for its limited accuracy and enjoy a higher kill ratio than ever before.


Both innovations are on sale now at the hangar – don't wait!
Weather on Zula 31During the day:
Blistering cold temperatures with occasional sulfur-laden flurries and a maximum high of approx. -87°. The southerly Zanziwinds will pick up in the afternoon resulting in a drop in temperature.

Overnight:
Expect the mercury to plummet, last week's record low is about to be broken. Meteorologists warn of a cold snap and predict -124° weather. Local sulfuric snowstorms with severe electric activity may also occur. Please exercise extreme caution when leaving the atmosphere.Massive meteor impact imminentThe moon known as Gora is about to be hit by a meteor. The last few attempts to divert the path of Ganibar 16 failed. The meteor is about the size of a Class 3 generator, and scientists were unable to destroy this seemingly impervious projectile because of its dense titanium surface. The Polaris system's barely inhabited satellite has been completely evacuated. The scientists were the last inhabitants to abandon their research and leave the surface. Billions of Uridium in damage are expected.Power-packed attackThe DMG-BO1 damage booster catalyzes rocket and laser energy, thereby increasing their damage output by 10%. Ten percent may not seem like a lot, but it might just save your butt! The DMG-BO1 is just one of eight available boosters. It'll serve you faithfully in battle. Give it a whirl today and add some oomph to your attack with the damage booster.The ace up your sleeveQuadroForce's latest development: the SAB 50 shield absorber. A must-have in the daily defense against enemies. It drains energy from your enemy's shields and transfers it to your shield generators. If you find yourself in a sticky situation, the SAB 50 might just save the day. It's your ace up your sleeve!Expand your horizonsUpgrade your ship with up to six additional CPU slots and expand your possibilities. CPUs and other extras make life as a space pilot much easier, but there are only a limited number of slots on each ship. The SL CPU series offers you slot expansions in four different sizes. Expand your horizons today with the SLO3 CPU!Hellstorm season is in full swing!Attention Space Pilots!

The rocket launcher was released onto the market only a short while ago, but it's already become standard equipment for every successful fighter pilot. And its popularity continues to soar as new technology is developed.

Starting today, two new high-tech rockets are available for the rocket launcher.

  • UBR-100 was designed to inflict massive damage on aliens and is equipped with state-of-the-art warheads which are at least 80% more effective against aliens than conventional HSTRM-01 rockets.*
  • The ECO-10 rocket was designed to be economical, giving you better value for your money.

With the perfect rocket for every situation, you can get the most out of your rocket launcher - whether you're taking down aliens with the UBR-100 or saving cash with the ECO-10.

Perfect tactics require ... the right rockets!


* The UBR-100 rocket is only available for a limited time.

Get it now: More slots for even more possibilities!Not enough slots on board? Get your hands on the power expansion for your ship: The SL04 CPU gives you more slots for more possibilities!

  • Equip your ship with ten additional slots for CPUs and extras.
  • The SL CPU series offers slot expansions in four different sizes.
  • The more slots you have on board, the more extras and CPUs you'll be able to use.


Keep ahead of your competition! More CPUs and extras make your life as a space pilot that much easier. Don't wait - maximize your potential today with the SLO4 CPU.

The Skylab's new addition: The Tech Center!Check out the new Tech Center in the Skylab. Produce new weapons of war and get the one-up on your competition with the new Tech Center!

  • Collect raw materials to produce new items. If you don't have all the required materials, just use Uridium instead.
  • Use all your new Tech Center CPUs, weapons and items right away.
    • Expand the Tech Center with extra production facilities and produce multiple items simultaneously.

      • From the energy leech to the chain impulse and backup shields: There's something here for every battle situation.

      Win the arms race: Take down your enemies!

      Paron-1's rings are shrinkingBased on planet readings and research, scientists have determined that the rings surrounding Paron-1 are shrinking. Dr. Geewicki and his team of experts declared that in the last five years the diameter of the planet's rings has decreased by approx. 144 centimeters. Paron-1's large mass is the likely cause for this drastic change in size. It's not the shrinking rings that pose a great threat to Paron-1, but rather its very dense atmosphere, which protects the planet from meteors.Endurium found on X3-MRFThe PSR expedition team reports that significant supplies of Endurium have been found on a newly discovered asteroid. According to geologists, the minor planet X3-MRF in the Strium 7 solar system holds non-disclosed but considerable amounts of Endurium. Located close to a spiral nebula, it is very difficult to reach. To prevent others from getting their hands on these resources, the PSR has imposed an embargo, cutting off all normal space traffic to the area.

      Endurium can often be found in the form of small asteroids floating around in known space. But to make the resource's extraction worthwhile, Endurium must be uncontaminated and abundant. Supplies of such purity and abundance have never before been discovered, and PSR has not yet determined how best to process the ore. The conventional neutron radiators currently equipped on almost every modern vessel are way too small for a job of this magnitude. PSR has not disclosed any further information - only time will tell what is to be made of X3-MRF.New DarkOrbit client

      Your DarkOrbit TeamShip with home advantageScientific breakthrough in the research labs: Powerful new alloy for the Leonov class


      Loyal employees of the company,

      Our research labs have just made an exciting announcement! They've successfully outfitted the Leonov-class ships with a revolutionary Promerium alloy. Welded in extreme conditions, this alloy makes it possible for the Leonovs to receive a high-energy beam which is transmitted from home base.       For more details, head for the "Ships" area in the hangar. Ships receiving the beam will be surrounded by a blue haze. This will make it easier to identify them as stronger adversaries.

      Finally, a cost-effective way for new pilots to better defend themselves from stronger enemy ships! All previously purchased Leonovs have already been outfitted with the new alloy - at no extra cost to their owners.

    Greetings Space Pilots,


    As you all know, there's strength in numbers. To help you achieve your goals, we're introducing an group system to DarkOrbit.

    You'll now be able to form temporary groups with your in-game friends in order to accomplish quests and achieve a common purpose.

    So get out there and join an existing group, or form your own: and guide them to victory.

    Thanks to the group system, your intergalactic adventures will be more action-packed and exciting than ever - fighting in groups is more thrilling and more effective.

    What are you waiting for? Round up your group and take on more than ever before.

    DarkOrbit's Spring Fight

    Greetings Space Pilots,



    Get in on the action and start this season off right - DarkOrbit's Spring Fight is just around the bend. Satisfy your need for adventure with one of the many Spring Fight events from March 31 to April 5, 2010.

    Supersonic Space Hunt

    Sound the alarms, it's hunting season! Stock up on weapons and fight on behalf of your company in the Supersonic Space Hunt from March 31 to April 5. There will be three new titles for your company to get during this time.

    The goal of the Supersonic Space Hunt is to win all of these titles: The company with all three titles on Monday at 11:00pm wins!

    Keep your eyes peeled for the following titles:

    • MMO Spring Fighter
    • EIC Spring Fighter
    • VRU Spring Fighter

    This year spring is bound to be better than ever with additional surprises such as the Capture the Beacon tournament and Spaceball events.

    Buckle up for adventure!

    Your DarkOrbit Team

    DarkOrbit's Spring Fight - Capture the Beacon

    Greetings Space Pilots,



    Don't miss out - Capture the Beacon is back! A Capture the Beacon tournament will begin on the hour every hour. Start your engines and move fast to get the beacons!

    The winning company of a CTB round will receive their reward at some time during the next hour. The company with the most wins will take home the prize of the day.

    Here's a recap of CTB rules:

    • Each company has a special zone on the X-2 map. In this zone, there are two enemy company beacons which you need to protect.
    • At the same time you must try to retrieve your own beacons from the enemy X-2 maps.
    • You'll receive one point as soon as your company brings its own beacon into its own zone and you prevent the enemy teams from capturing their beacons.
    • The player who has captured a beacon will be clearly displayed on the mini map and will be unprotected no matter where he/she is during this time.
    • If this player is using his/her cloaking device, it will be deactivated. The current score of a match and the position of all beacons can seen on the star chart.
    DarkOrbit's Spring Fight Finale - Spaceball

    Greetings Space Pilots,



    Give it your all one last time, the end is near. The final Spring Fight event is here: Spaceball! The company that wins Spaceball will win the day and all its members will receive a 15% experience point bonus. Members of the second-placed company will receive a 5% EP bonus.

    Here's a breakdown of the rules:

    • A spaceball will be placed in the middle of the 4-4 map. Each company will have a goal-gate on this map. (Requirement to play: Level 9)
    • It's your goal to try to shoot the spaceball through your company's gate. You'll get one point per goal.
    • Shoot at the spaceball and watch it go hyperactive. The more you damage the spaceball, the faster it will move towards your company's gate.

    Playing on the new DarkOrbit client is the only way for you to form groups and collaborate to fight off common enemies!Get strategic with the plasma chargerTop-secret weapon plans found at the company labs: The discovery of preliminary weapon blueprints has burst onto the DarkOrbit scene!

    But it looks like we weren't the first ones there: other spies have tampered with the information. Although we don't know which company is behind these devious plans, we do know that the plasma charger will allow you to take down your enemies' systems with space distortion!

    1. The plasma charger fills your rockets with plasma.
    2. Upon exploding, the rockets will form a molecular cloud.
    3. The molecular cloud will temporarily affect your enemies' weapons systems.

    These weapons will wreak major havoc on your enemies' accuracy, making it possible for you to take them out while their systems are compromised.

    Use the plasma charger strategically: You can only re-use it once it has been refilled, and it will take a heavy toll on your generator. But it also means lights out for your enemies!

    The Booster Happy Hour on Sunday: 50% damage boosters for the galaxy gatesGreetings Space Pilots,

    It's the opportunity of a lifetime: Play the galaxy gates this Sunday and clean up!

    From 2:00pm to 8:00pm, when you enter a galaxy gate, you'll get a 50% damage booster. It'll only be active during this time and in a galaxy gate universe.

    This is your chance to play a galaxy gate through to the end. Don't miss out!Action for all: The new Invasion gates are here!Greetings Space Pilots,

    This just in: DarkOrbit is introducing Invasion gates for pilots of all levels! In the past, many of you haven't had the shadow of a chance in the Invasion gate, but now all pilots, regardless of their level, will have a fair shot at scoring cool bonus items and downing enemy ships in exciting space fights.

    In the Invasion Gate Event on this coming Saturday from 4:00pm to 10:00pm, there will be 3 level groups: newbies, experienced fighters and seasoned space professionals.

    Each level group will have a different map:

    1. Level 1-6 pilots will play on the x-1 map.
    2. Level 7-12 pilots will play on the x-3 map.
    3. Pilots at Level 13 and above will play on the x-5 map.

    The Invasion gates will only be playable from the assigned level. Make your way to your gate early to beat the rush.

    We wish all pilots the best of luck in their interstellar pursuits!New delivery of Skylab robots!The Skylab just received a delivery of new robots for you to use to boost your productivity and increase the Skylab's efficiency.

    1. Click on Productivity in the individual windows to get the robots.
    2. Each robot increases your productivity without using any additional resources.
    3. You can only have a certain number of robots for each building.


    Tip: Make sure to pay attention to how many robots are being used and how long they've been working - even the best robots won't last forever.

    Move fast and improve your productivity with these tiny tinkerers!The thrill of the chase: the PvP Bounty Hunt extravaganza!Greetings Space Pilots,

    This Wednesday to Sunday, you'll be the hunter and the hunted - during DarkOrbit's Bounty Hunt, every pilot is fair game!

    Fire away at friends and foes in this PvP free-for-all. You'll get points no matter who your victim works for, but your company will get extra points when you down pilots from enemy companies.

    1. Players will be spread out over all maps: It's up to you to chase them down and blow them up.
    2. But no feeding on the small fry! You'll only get points for shooting down players of equal strength.
    3. Your own points and the top ten will be posted in the stats on the website.

    For the duration, you can forget friendship, alliance and mercy - everyone will have their eyes on the prize. Each day's winner will be granted the unique title of PvP Hunter of the Day for the following day.

    The overall winner will receive the title PvP Bounty Hunter until the next Bounty Hunt event.

    Happy hunting, pilots!Customize your DarkOrbit gameplay with 25 new skillsGreetings Space Pilots,

    Our top scientists have discovered a way to decipher log-disks salvaged from wrecked spaceships. The log-disk recordings have helped us to expand our knowledge of the universe and develop new technologies.

    Collect log-disks and support your company in its endeavor to stay on the cutting-edge. You'll be able to trade in your collected log-disks for pilot points that can be used to learn new skills in three different categories: offense, defense and production.

    Here's how it works:

    • Collect log-disks
    • Exchange the log-disks for pilot points
    • Use your pilot points to upgrade the skills listed in your pilot bio

    Give it a try, it's really quite simple. Just collect log-disks for pilot points and use your pilot points to learn new skills and expand your horizons.

    It's up to you decide what skills you want to learn. There are 25 awesome skills for you to choose from to customize your gaming style.

    Take this chance to sharpen your skills and blast light-years ahead of the competition!Massive graphics update: A new look for all shipsGreetings Space Pilots,

    It's time for change at DarkOrbit, and we've revamped your spaceships in the framework of a massive graphics update.

    Something new for every ship:

    Pimped-up classics
    The most popular ships will be keeping the same basic shape, we've just spiffed them up and made a few small changes.

    The next generation in ship design
    A few ship models have been fully overhauled and now have a completely new look.

    Curious? Then head to the space maps, see what's new, and take the company war to the next level in your new ship.An awesome new design + increased firepower for your GoliathOur engineers worked on this project for a full year, and it's finally finished and available at the hangar:

    The new Combat Goliath design

    For the first time ever, when you buy this new design, you'll be able to keep your old design and switch between them in the equipment area.

    1. Get your hands on the new Combat Design.
    2. Equip your Goliath with it in the equipment area of the hangar.
    3. Not only will your ship look different, you'll receive a 5% damage bonus on all your weapons.


    Get the new Combat Design, head out to the space maps and blast away your enemies with 5% more damage!Let your enemies feel your wrath with the Vengeance Damage Design: the REVENGE

    DarkOrbit proudly presents the REVENGE, the new Vengeance battle design.
    - Now available at the hangar -

    Get yourself the Damage Design and pay your enemies back in pain. With the brand-new REVENGE design for your Vengeance, your spaceship's never been so stylish, and it's never packed a bigger punch!

    1. A new and improved look for your Vengeance
    2. Increased capability - 5% more damage
    3. Easy design switch in the equipment area

    With the new design, your weapons systems will become even more deadly. Get yourself the Revenge and pay your enemies back tenfold!

    Equip your Vengeance with the new REVENGE design in the hangar equipment area: Not only will your ship have a brand-new look, your weapons will also inflict an awesome 5% more damage!

    Launch a counterstrike with the EMP burst - your secret weapon!Surrounded by enemies? In a dead-end situation? Then use the EMP burst! An electromagnetic impulse wave will temporarily interfere with your enemies' onboard instruments, short-circuiting their targeting devices and quite possibly damaging their cloaking devices.

    1. The EMP burst is like an expanding force field.
    2. It is emitted from your ship and expands outwards to deactivate the targeting devices of all ships within range.
    3. Once you use the EMP burst, nobody will be able to target you for 3 seconds.
    4. Use the EMP burst carefully, it has a 35-second cool-down time. Without a clever strategy, you might end up at the mercy of your enemies!

    Get ready for a big bang - take down enemy targeting devices, uncloak their ships and blow 'em out of space. Your time has come!


    Reload in a flash with the rocket launcher!Bring out the big guns: It's time for drastic measures! With the rocket launcher you can bombard the enemy with a cataclysmic surge of destruction. Releasing 3 or 5 rockets at once, both types of rocket launcher will make sure your enemies go down in a blaze of fire.

    Use the launcher's specially designed rockets, batter your enemy with a broadside of missiles and light up the sky with a shower of rockets!

    Independence Day fireworksWelcome to the biggest Independence Day celebration in the universe. Play to win your own fireworks and help us transform the sky into a colorful mosaic of red, white and blue on July 4.

    The 4th of July is a very important date for the people of space: It celebrates the most important technological breakthrough of all time - the jump portal. With this technology, pilots were able to cover long distances in a fraction of a second for the first time ever and were able to explore strange new worlds and new galaxies, thus freeing themselves from their dependency on individual planets and solar systems.

    Put on your protective eyewear and buckle up for a spectacular display of fireworks: On July 4th the rockets will streak through the sky in red, blue and white!

    The Reapers are on the move!!!Fight harder, pilots! Reaper sightings are on the rise across the universe.

    Pull out the big guns and give it all you got,or else no one is safe!
    Invasion of the Reapers

    Centuries ago, pirates called "The Reapers" waged a huge war for control of our galaxy and were pushed back to the outskirts of the known universe. We assumed they'd vanished forever, but we wrong! They've been lurking in the shadows ever since, slowly rebuilding their fleet and pillaging anything that dares stray into their part of the galaxy; stripping it of anything, and anyone, that was useful.

    Aggressive and relentless, these pirates will stop at nothing short of galactic domination. With ships made from scrap metal salvaged from our own defense fleets, they've perfected our own technologies and turned them against us, making themselves stronger than ever before. Living on the outer edges of the galaxy taught the Reapers the importance of sticking together: They work in packs, with ships of different and unknown capabilities.

    In sector 4-5, what was previously thought to be a one-way wormhole, the Reapers are starting to mass their fleet! Hold them back before they can advance further into our space. This threat is going nowhere fast, and they're here to destroy us - one way or another! If we learned anything from the past, it's that they attack in waves. Prepare for the battle of a lifetime: This could be the start of a massive invasion!

    Until now we've only been able to collect limited data on the Reapers' new ships. Here's what we know so far:

    Fighter class: Code name "Interceptor"
    Very fast and small, the Interceptors are the Reapers' first response. They attack in large numbers and try to eliminate any resistance before it reaches their main force.

    Pull yourselves together, space pilots. Let's take to the fight to this new threat!
    Incoming shock wave!Red alert! We just detected the birth of a supernova on the outer edges of deep space. A burst of radiation is now sweeping across the universe and is expected to hit today.

    Brace for impact! Once this baby hits, it'll play havoc on your electronic systems and make your enemy detection system completely unreliable.
    Don't let it play tricks on you. Trust your instincts and play it safe out there.

    Over and out!
    The AnnihilatorBad news, space pilots!

    I'm afraid we failed to drive back the Reapers in sector 4-5. It turns out they're smarter than we thought. They figured out how to use our jump portals and now they're starting to infest the X-5 sectors. It's as if they're looking for something that we don't know about. The good news however is that we managed to collect some intel on another one of their ships:

    Destroyer class: Code name "Annihilator"



    When it's heavy artillery the Reapers need, it's the Annihilators they call. Although slower than the other ships, the Annihilator makes up for its sluggishness with heavy defenses and devastating weaponry. The Reapers use this superior firepower to their advantage, dishing out major damage to anything that dares cross their path.

    Man the battle stations and hold off the pirates as long as you can. In the meantime, we'll figure out a way to win back our territory!The BarracudaOur efforts are failing! The pirates have learned a trick or two since our last encounter, and have pushed through our defenses and infiltrated sectors X-6 and X-7.

    The Reapers are advancing too quickly and in droves. We need to act fast and find a new way to combat them! Here's some helpful intel to help you in your fight:

    Bomber class: code name "Barracuda"



    Produced in masses, the Barracuda is the Reapers' main line of defense thanks to its versatility in battle and effective performance.

    Navigated by fearless fighters, Barracuda pilots have no problem giving their lives to serve the cause. When things get out of hand in battle and they see no way out, these kamikaze pilots will close in on their target and detonate special on-board explosives. Carelessness around the Barracuda will cost you your life.

    Regain the upper hand and stop the Reapers before it's too late for us to undo the damage!
    New Reaper ship sightedOur resistance has failed again. The Reapers have infiltrated our home bases in the X-8 sectors and are pushing forward at a rapid rate.

    There's only one solution: Group up and exterminate this plague! Among the ranks of the Reapers we've discovered a new class:

    Cruiser class: Code name "Saboteur"



    The Saboteurs are quite possibly the most deadliest Reaper ships out there. They have special equipment to latch onto their prey and immobilize it. They then drag themselves in close making it impossible to damage them without damaging yourself.

    Saboteurs may be the turning point in any battle, but you aren't completely helpless against them. We've determined a weakness: An EMP burst could disrupt their systems and set you free from their clutches.

    Don't think you're out of the woods just yet. They'll learn from their mistakes, so only use this tactic when you truly must.

    Join forces once more, pilots! Our survival depends on it!Retreat of the Reapers ... PSYCH!The Reapers are pulling out of our sectors. I don’t know what you did but whatever it was, it sure worked! Well done, pilots! After all that fighting, you sure deserve a well-earned break …

    But wait … What's that?

    Oh no, this isn't good.

    It looks like the pirates only retreated to gather scrap from our battered and broken hulls in order to build a new base. The Reapers have taken and modified our warp technology and to turn it against us.

    They've built one-way gates to ensure that there's no easy way out for pilots who venture into their space. They've set up gates in sector 4-5 that lead to their own territory; once on the other side, the only gate there will lead you back to sector 4-4.

    A deadly new enemy patrols the Reapers' base. And this is what we know about them:

    Mothership: Code name "Battleray"



    The Battleray is the largest and most powerful ship in the Reaper fleet. It serves as a support vessel for the rest of the armada and is used as launch pad for smaller Reaper ships such as the Interceptors.

    It can launch wave after wave of Interceptors into space and repair damaged Interceptors by by sending out a burst of energy. As long as there's a certain number of Interceptors in its vicinity, the Battleray is next to indestructible.

    Team up and take on the Battleray - it's the only way you'll ever stand a chance!

    A pilot's best friend - the P.E.T 10Introducing a space revolution: The P.E.T. 10!

    With a P.E.T. 10 you are never alone! It'll back you up when you're in a bind and take care of different jobs! Now's your chance to have your own P.E.T. 10. Buy one in the hangar and take advantage of its numerous perks:

    2. Install AI protocols and enhance your P.E.T.'s performance with better armor, more storage and stronger lasers!
    3. Watch your P.E.T. 10 collect EP and evolve as it levels up!


    The P.E.T. 10 is the ultimate companion in space, but also the ultimate weapon!

    4. Second place to tenth place in the best-player ranking won't fly away empty-handed, they'll get 10,000 rounds of X-4 ammo, 7,500 Uridium and each mine type 50 times.
    5. 11th place to 30th place in the best-player ranking will score 7,500 rounds of X4 ammo, 3,000 Uridium and each mine type 25 times.

    Act now and brighten up the dark expanses of space!VENGEANCE DESIGNSpecial bulletin: Valuable cargo chests dumped into space by the retreating pirates!The pirates have been successfully pushed back to their own sector of space and our star system is safely back in our hands.

    • The pirates were forced to hastily withdraw and left valuable treasure chests in their wake. Unlike normal boxes, you'll need a key to open these chests which you can purchase in the hangar.
    • Reports from the first pilots to open the chests are coming in and they appear to contain impressive contents, such as a new laser.

    Help us keep these valuable items from falling back into the pirate hands and collect all the pirate chests.

    Even normal NPCs didn't shy away from the battle against the pirates and managed to collect some of the chests for themselves. If you destroy these NPCs, you can claim the "Pirate Booty" for yourself.
    News about the P.E.T. 10We've taken into consideration your feedback on the P.E.T. 10 and have put it straight to use. Here's a list of the new changes:

    • Repair costs
      From level 1 to 2, it will now cost you nothing to repair your P.E.T. Starting at level 3, you'll have to start to pay for repairs. Costs will increase by ten Uridium for every level, capping off at 350 Uridium at level 15.
    • P.E.T. speed
      Up until now the P.E.T. 10 has been too slow for you to effectively use. That's why we increased its speed from 100% of the normal player speed to 130%.
    • Auto collection gear
      In the past, when the P.E.T. was in collection mode, it would always attempt to collect the same boxes as the actual player. With a bit of technological magic, we've changed this so that the P.E.T. now collects much more efficiently.
    • More power for higher levels
      Now with five additional levels, the P.E.T. 10 will be more robust and aggressive in combat. Upon reaching level 15, it will also be given a new look.
    • Hot keys
      Many players have asked for hot keys to help use the P.E.T. 10. To start off, we've created two new hot keys: The [E] key activates or deactivates the P.E.T. and the [R] key sets it in guard mode. This will allow you to defend yourself to the best of your ability the moment you're attacked.

    The Tech Center is a factory where you can use various materials to produce hi-tech defense and attack items, including Tech items and drones.

    • Select an item to produce from the left-hand menu in the Factory.
    • Click on Produce to make the item: Make sure you have all the required materials for production.
    • Build extra production facilities to produce multiple items simultaneously.

    Or:

    • Select a drone type in the Factory
    • and build the drone instantly for Uridium.
    • In the pirate booty you'll sometimes find pieces of the blueprints. The advantage: You can build a drone with them without additional costs.
    • Tip: Each piece of the blueprints that you find reduces the price for buying it immediately.

    Use tech items in battle directly on the space map. Start now and turn your ship into the ultimate spacefighter!

    For more information, take a look in our FAQ!


    What exactly is the Tech Center?

    The Tech Center is a factory where you can produce hi-tech items that can be used to acquire new skills or enhance existing ones. There are many different tech items available.

    Where is the Tech Center located?

    The Tech Center can be found in the Skylab. Click on Skylab in the main menu and the Skylab page will open. There are two tabs on this page: One for the Skylab and one for the Tech Center. Click on the Tech Center tab to go there.

    What type of tech items can be produced?

    There are many different items that can be produced in the Tech Center, such as:Energy leech

    Plain and simple: The more damage you inflict on your enemy, the more the energy leech will repair your ship.
    This item transforms a certain percentage of the laser damage you cause into HP and transfers it back to your ship in the form of energy, thus allowing you to repair your ship.

    Chain impulse

    When you shoot at an enemy with the chain impulse, it emits an energy pulse which inflicts damage on your target. The pulse then ricochets to your next adversary, and the next one, causing each one less damage than the one before. It can inflict damage on a maximum of 7 opponents, after which it dissipates, becoming too weak to damage further ships. The chain impulse penetrates through all shields, causing direct damage to the ships in its path.

    Precision targeter

    This tech item increases your hit ratio to 100% for a certain amount of time.

    Backup shields

    The backup shields are a type of reserve shield. If your regular shield is destroyed in battle, the backup shields will replace some of your shield defenses instantly.

    Battle repair bot

    The battle repair bot functions like a normal repair bot, but it was developed for use in battle situations. It can resist enemy fire for a short time, repairing 10,000 HP per second for 10 seconds.

    Speed leech

    The speed leech sucks energy from enemy speed generators and transfers it to your ship. Your target's speed decreases by 25% and yours increases by 25% for 5 seconds. The speed leech is an effective accessory in fight or flight.

    How many tech items can be produced?

    At the beginning, you can only produce one tech item at a time. If you build multiple production facilities, you can produce multiple items simultaneously. Once your Tech Center has been completely expanded, you'll be able to produce three tech items at once.

    What materials are needed to produce tech items?

    The materials needed to make tech items are Credits, Seprom and log-disks. Credits and log-disks can be collected in the game and Seprom has to created in the Skylab.

    Can tech items be produced if all required materials aren't available?

    Yes. In this case, you can replace the missing materials with Uridium. Uridium helps to speed up the production process.

    Where do the finished tech items go? How can they be used?

    Your tech items will appear in a special box on the space map once they have been manufactured. There you'll be able to see how long you can use them for and how long the cool-down time is. Click on the tech item symbol to use the item.

    Can I use multiple tech items at once?

    Yes. Using multiple tech items at once will turn your ship into an ultimate starfighter. Remember to use your tech items effectively: Combine different types of tech items for a killer effect. Combining the same type of tech items won't do much for you.

    Starting now, we're introducing a new system that will help us crack down on players who use illegal software applications (bots) to run automated tasks to gain an advantage in the game.

    Game accounts using a bot younger than four weeks will be immediately deleted without warning.

    Users who have game accounts with a bot older than four weeks will be penalized based on our new system with different penalty levels.

    Level 1

    The player will be banned for one day. Afterwards the player will be able to log back into DarkOrbit using a so-called CAPTCHA code. As a penalty, the player will have the following deducted from their account:

    • 20% EP
    • 10% honor
    • 33% Credits
    • 100% Jackpot money
    • 100% galaxy gate energy

    Level 2

    If the user continue to use the bot after the first warning and penalty has been issued, their account will be banned for seven days. Afterwards they will be able to log back into DarkOrbit using a so-called CAPTCHA code. As a penalty, the player will have the following deducted from their account:

    • 50% EP
    • 50% honor
    • 50% Credits
    • 100% Jackpot money
    • 100% galaxy gate energy

    Level 3

    If the user continues to use the bot after the second warning and second penalty has been issued, their account will be banned forever.

A gruff bounty hunter with a lust for direct action, Morgus Petterson found himself climbing the corporate ladder after years of loyally murderous freelance work for MMO and less reputable organizations. Exactly why he was hired to lead MMO’s human resources department is unknown. Regardless, his lust for execution - in all meanings of the word – has greatly endeared him to upper management. His unending elitism has led to him being given the nickname “Admiral Blueblood”.We at Venus Resources Unlimited pride ourselves in our ability to push the envelope of technological advancement, while retaining our family atmosphere. Some call us a sick cult with allusions of galactic domination, but they simply misunderstand our brilliant recruitment methods. We are always looking for talented pilots to help us destroy our enemies and extend our galactic dominance.Vanessa Arkadium is a lethal assassin trained in the dark arts of information extraction – any and all means will be utilized. Raised by VRU from birth, Vanessa is completely indoctrinated and will do anything company management ask of her. Although still young, there are already legends praising her exploits, which has made colleagues envious and uncomfortable in her presence. Rival company operatives refer to her as the “Fluffy Dagger”.

    DarkOrbit – Join the intergalactic struggle for control of the galaxy

    Engage the thrusters and prepare for battle in the free space MMO. Team up with millions of space pilots for a bitter fight to the end

    Listen up space pilot! The vast expanse of DarkOrbit awaits! Choose your spacecraft and make for your battle station poste-haste to lend a fighting hand to the efforts of mankind and vanquish the alien vermin threatening the existence of man. Take up the fight as you range the galaxy at the helm of your very own space ship. Sign up today in DarkOrbit, become a space pilot, place your allegiances in one of three factions, while joining forces with fellow pilots or forming clans in an effort to round up valuable resources and lead your faction to victory, while dispatching scores of galactic garbage in the free-to-play space game for your computer’s browser!

    Whatever the Company you keep, it’s yours in the Galaxy

    However, evil aliens are not the only danger lurking about in Bigpoint’s action-packed space MMO! Begin your journey through space in DarkOrbit by selecting one of three rival factions - each replete with their own philosophy of achieving victory in this interstellar fight. Use force, might and aggression in the Mars Mining Organization to emerge victorious, achieve your goals with monetary might in the Earth Industries Corporation or wield cunning and grace to defeat your enemies in the Venus Resources Unlimited. No matter your decision, your mission remains the same: compile valuable resources and turn the tide of the galactic struggle to claim victory in this shooter full of fulminant space action.

    Command the Ship of your Choice

    Faction affiliations notwithstanding, Bigpoint’s smash space browser game gives you a plethora of unique options of putting your own personal touch on your individual struggle throughout space. DarkOrbit puts you in command – find your spacecraft from a host of specialized ships: from ships specialized in laying quick waste to enemy hordes and swift space ships fleet of foot designed to gather invaluable intel to bulky contraptions of high-tech brawn that lay down vital cover to your allies, while meting out heavy damage to targets.

    Join the Epitome of an Online Community

    What truly makes DarkOrbit unique, setting it apart from the competition is one thing: You! While other browser games claim to be multiplayer, they simply cannot hold a flame to DarkOrbit’s massive community: over 80 million active players blast off each and every day. Thanks to You and yours, DarkOrbit is the premiere cult online space games. Join the skirmish today alongside millions of space pilots or stand against floes of imposing enemies determined to see out your destruction. Arm your weapons and remain ready – with danger lurking at every turn, a moment’s hesitation can be the difference between success or failure.

    Fight with Friends, or Against

    Roam the myriad of galaxies of one of the all-time favorite space shooters. Fraught with danger at seemingly every turn, players must be on their guard and remain alert while scouring for resources, discovering new maps or completing a host of new missions. Form a clan with your friends and respected fellow pilots to boost your chances of victory and survival against hordes of imposing intergalactic beasts, or take on the most intimidating missions as you and your crew attempt to level up at the speed of light.You can only rename your Pilot once every 48 hours.
